rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors of recurring awards that are given to winners of a specific soccer match, e.g. FIFA World Cup or Copa Libertadores.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Award

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about disciplinary actions that players incurred during a match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Disciplinary Action

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the match in question.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Match

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the minute of the game when the punishment was given to the player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minute

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the player who was disciplined.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the card or warning that was given to the player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Punishment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the cards, viz. yellow and red, that are given to soccer players in matches for infractions of game rules.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disciplinary Punishment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a disciplinary punishment to information about the player who received the punishment and the match he was playing when he received it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player

rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This is not an appropriate type. Use instead the entity "F??d??ration Internationale de Football Association". DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: leagues_governed
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use soccer.league.league instead to relate one soccer league to another. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:soccer.league.league]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the goals made by a team during a soccer match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Goal

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the kind of goal, e.g. "own goal" (a score made by a player of the team that is defending the goal) or a "penalty goal" (a score made during a penalty kick).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Goal Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the match in which the goal was scored.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Match

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the minute of the game when the goal was made by the player. Note that this property covers regular time. Stoppage time, if there is any, should be recorded with the property mso:soccer.goal.stoppage_time.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minute

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the team that was awarded the goal. Note that this team may in some cases by different from the team of the player who made the goal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Point Awarded to

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the player who made the goal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Scorer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of stoppage time minutes on the clock, if any, when the goal was made. Stoppage time is time that is added to the regular match time to account for time that is lost during the first or second half of the match due to substitutions, removal of injured players, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Stoppage Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An organization that regulates or administers soccer leagues.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Governing Body

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing all groupings of soccer teams. It includes the F??d??ration Internationale de Football Association, as well as every soccer association under FIFA.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer League

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer league to an organization responsible for organizing or regulating the league.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Governing Body

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer league to another league which is a part of the first.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: League

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer league to the league system of which it is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: League System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The season this team began playing in this league
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The league participated in
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: League

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The last season this team spent in the league during this period of participation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A soccer league season is a series of association football matches played as part of a soccer league over a defined period of time which generally leads to a final ranking.
Things that are a soccer league season:
## Seasons of professional association football leagues (e.g. FA Premier League 1998-99, 2009-10 La Liga, Serie A 2008-09, A-League 2006-07).
## Seasons of amateur association football leagues (e.g. 2009???10 Season of the Fu??ball-Bundesliga, Ukrainian Football Amateur League 2007).
Things that are NOT a soccer league season:
## Seasons of non-association football games such as American football, rugby, and Australian rules football (e.g. 2005 NFL Season, 1990-91 Rugby Football League Season, 2005 Australian Football International Cup). Use mso:sports.season for these.
## Association football matches (e.g. 2008 UEFA Cup Final, 2006 Royal League Final, England v Hungary). Use mso:soccer.match in these cases.
## Association football leagues (e.g. Norwegian Premier League for Women, La Liga, Big Ten Conference). Use mso:soccer.league for these.
## Olympic football events (e.g. Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics - Men???s tournament, Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics - Women???s tournament). Use mso:olympics.event_competition in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer League Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The league this season was part of
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: League
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:sports.season.league instead, as this item will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[jcoop] Successor:[mso:sports.season.league]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The football games held as part of this seasons
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Matches

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The teams participating in this season
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Teams

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A league system is a hierarchy of leagues in soccer, usually with a system of promotion and demotion between levels of the pyramid. Many nations have their own league system, e.g. the English Football League System.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer League System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a league system to one of the leagues making up the system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Leagues

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity containing the collection of all individual soccer games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Match

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer match to one of the two officials who assist the referee from the touchline, especially in deciding whether the ball is out of play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Assistant Referees

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The spectator attendance at the stadium for this game
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Attendance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer match to information about the disciplinary actions that were performed during the match, viz. who was awarded yellow and/or red cards and when.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disciplinary Action

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer match to information about the goals that were made during the match
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Goals

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer match to the stadium or football field where the match was held.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer match to information about the managers of the teams who participated in the match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Managers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer match to information about the soccer players who participated in the match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player Match Participation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer match to information about which players relieved which players during the match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Substitution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer match to the person responsible for enforcing the rules of soccer during the match. Note that the property soccer.match.assistant_referees should be used for assistant referees in a match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Referee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The two teams who participated in this game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Teams

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing sports fields or stadiums where soccer matches are played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer Pitch

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a soccer stadium or sports field to a match that was played there.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Matches

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A type containing professional soccer players, i.e. members of teams that are part of FIFA.
Things that are soccer players:
Professional soccer players (e.g. David Beckham, Ronaldinho, Peter Crouch and Mia Hamm).
Things that are NOT soccer players:
Players of other variants of football. Use mso:american_football.player for American football players such as ???Mean Joe??? Greene. Use mso:sports.pro_athlete for other kinds of footballers, e.g. rugby players, Canadian football players, Australian rules football players, and Gaelic football players.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer Player

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer player to information about disciplinary actions he received in matches during his career.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disciplinary Action

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to a value indicating whether the player is left-footed, right-footed or ambidextrous.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dominant Foot

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer player to information about the goals scored by the player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Goals Scored

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer player to information about the instances when the player was loaned to other teams.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Loans

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer player to information about matches in which the player has participated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Matches Played

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a soccer player to his or her career national statistics. These statistics represent the total goals, appearances, and so forth for all of the player's national team appearances in international competitions. National teams usually compete in events like FIFA competitions and in the Summer Olympics. A player doesn't necessarily need to be a citizen to represent a country in international competitions, but the player must have a demonstrable, clear connection to the country. Usually a player will only play for one national team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: National Career

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to information about cases when the player was sold to another team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player Transfer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to the position on the field that he normally plays, e.g. goalkeeper or striker.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Position

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a soccer player to his or her senior career statistics. These statitics represent the total goals, appearances, and so forth for all of the player's professional club teams, excluding national team appearances. Professional clubs operate on a domestic level, meaning each country operates its own league system, and a player may play in many different domestic teams throughout his or her career. Senior career statistics combine all the player's appearances in these domestic matches.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Senior Career

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to the total number of games of the player in his career, including both international and club appearances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Career Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to the sum of all goals scored by the player during his career, including both club and international appearances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Career Goals

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to the total number of international appearances at any level including U-21 or B team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of International Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer player to the total number of goals scored by the player for an international team at all levels, including U-21 or B team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of International Goals

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about cases when players are temporarily loaned by one team to another team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Player Loan

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the team for which the player played temporarily.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Borrowing Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the loan started.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the team that is temporarily providing the player to another team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lending Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the player who was loaned.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the loan ended.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the players in a particular soccer match, e.g. what team they played for, what their shirt numbers were, and whether they were part of the starting lineup.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Player Match Participation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the given soccer match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Match

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether the given player was on the field when the game started.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part of Starting Lineup

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number on the jersey of the given player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Shirt Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the soccer team that the given player represented at the match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the instances when a player is replaced by another player during a match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Player Substitution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the given match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Match

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the minute of the game when the replacement of players happened.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minute

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the player who came off the field.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Off

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the player who came on the field.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: On

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about instances when a player from one team is sold to another team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Player Transfer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the agreement was made to sell the given player to the purchasing team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Transfer was Agreed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the amount of money paid by the purchasing team for the player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the player who was sold.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Player

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the team that is buying the given player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Purchasing Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the team that is selling the given player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Selling Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the currency in which the purchasing team paid the fee for the given player.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Transfer Fee Currency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for roles of soccer players, e.g. goalkeeper or striker.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer Position

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for enforcing the rules of soccer during a match. Note that this type includes both main and assistant referees.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer Referee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer referee to a match at which he or she was an assistant referee.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Assistant Referee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer referee to a match at which he or she was the main referee.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Main Referee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of games played by this player for this team during this tenure
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Total number of Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date the player began using this position and number within this team
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The typical jersey/shirt number of this player
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The position in the team which this player played. e.g Goalkeeper, Striker
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Position

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The football team whom the player plays for and trains with.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date this player ceased being using this position/number or stopped playing for this team
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The total number of goals scored by this player during this tenure with this team
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of goals scored

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A football (soccer) team is a sports team which participates in association football (soccer) games, or games of a variant form of association football (such as futsal). Note that the type includes only professional football teams.
Things that are soccer teams:
## Professional football teams (e.g. Estudiantes, FC Gold Pride, Bayer Leverkusen).
## Reserve teams (e.g. Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy, Liverpool F.C. Reserves, JEF United Ichihara Chiba Reserves).
## National football teams of countries (e.g. Spain national football team, Netherlands national football team, Brazil national football team).
## Teams of other variants of association football such as indoor soccer, futsal and five-a-side football (e.g. Spartans Futsal Club, Anaheim Splash).
Things that are NOT soccer teams:
## Football leagues (e.g. Major League Soccer). Use mso:soccer.league for these.
## American football teams (e.g. New York Giants). Use mso:american_football.team for these.
## Other kinds of professional football teams, such as rugby clubs, Canadian football teams, Australian rules football teams, and Gaelic football teams (e.g. South Sydney Rabbitohs). Use mso:sports.team for these.
## Football associations (e.g. FIFA). Use mso:sports.sports_club for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soccer Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a soccer team to information about players of the team that were temporarily borrowed from another team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Borrowed Players

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a soccer team to the governing body of soccer related to the team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Governing Body

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer team to information about the leagues of which the team is a member. Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to sports.league_participation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: League

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a soccer team to information about players of the team that were temporarily loaned to another team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Loaned Players

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soccer team to information about who has been the manager of the team and during which time frames.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer team to information about players that were purchased by the team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Purchased Players

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer team to information about players that were sold by the team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sold Players

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the time frame when a particular person managed a soccer team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Team Management Tenure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the manager took charge of the team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the manager of the soccer team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the team that was managed by the given person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the given person ceased managing the team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A coach of a soccer team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soccer team manager to information about the teams that he or she has managed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a team manager to information about the matches in which teams he or she has managed have participated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team Manager Match Participation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about which people managed which teams during a given match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football Team Manager Match Participation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the manager of the given team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manager

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the match in which the given team manager participated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Match

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the team represented by the given manager at the match.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Team

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all World Cup events. These are the individual tournaments of association football sponsored by FIFA, e.g. the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Football World Cup
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This is not an appropriate type. Use instead the entity "FIFA Club World Cup". DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:soccer.world_cup to its mso:sports.tournament_qualification_event that was the qualification for this world cup.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Qualifications
